Docs.summary: Serves as the base class for the different column types of the control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn> class is the base class for all column types of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control. It defines the properties and methods that are common to all column types. An instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn> class is not created directly.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this constructor to create and initialize an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn> class.
> [!NOTE] > Instances of this class are typically not created directly. It is a base class that defines the properties and methods common to all column type classes.

For more information about design mode, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.ISite.DesignMode%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property FooterStyle As TableItemStyle

Docs.summary: Gets the style properties for the footer section of the column.
Docs.value: A that contains the style properties for the footer section of the column. The default value is an empty .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this property to provide a custom style for the footer section of the column. Common style attributes that can be adjusted include foreground color, background color, font, and content alignment within the cell. Providing a different style enhances the appearance of the column in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn.FooterStyle%2A> property to set the style properties for the footer section of the column.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the text displayed in the footer section of the column.
Docs.value: The text displayed in the footer section of the column. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn.FooterText%2A> property to specify or determine the text displayed in the footer section of the column.
> [!CAUTION] > Text is not HTML-encoded before it is displayed in the footer section of the column. This makes it possible to embed script within HTML tags in the text. If this property is set dynamically using user input, be sure to validate the value to reduce security vulnerabilities.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn.FooterText%2A> property to specify the text displayed in the footer section of the column.

member this.HeaderImageUrl : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the location of an image to display in the header section of the column.
Docs.value: The location of an image to display in the header section of the column. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn.HeaderImageUrl%2A> property to specify the URL of an image to display in the header section of the column. You can use a relative or an absolute URL. A relative URL relates the location of the image to the location of the Web page without specifying a complete path on the server. The path is relative to the location of the Web page. This makes it easier to move the entire site to another directory on the server without updating the path to the image in code. An absolute URL provides the complete path, so moving the site to another directory requires updating the code.
> [!NOTE] > If you want to display text instead of an image in the header section of the column, set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn.HeaderText%2A> property instead of this property.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn.HeaderImageUrl%2A> property to specify the image displayed in the header section of the column.
[!code-aspx-csharp[DataGridColumnHeaderImageUrl#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/DataGridColumnHeaderImageUrl/CS/datagridcolumnheaderimageurlcs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[DataGridColumnHeaderImageUrl#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/DataGridColumnHeaderImageUrl/VB/datagridcolumnheaderimageurlvb.aspx#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Initialize() cil managed
abstract member Initialize : unit -> unit override this.Initialize : unit -> unit

Docs.summary: Provides the base implementation to reset a column derived from the class to its initial state.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn.Initialize%2A> method provides the base implementation to reset a column derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn> class to its initial state. This method is not called directly. Instead, this method is inherited by a derived column class, which can then be used to reset a column of the derived type. You can optionally override this method in the derived class to provide a custom initialization routine. This base implementation of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn.Initialize%2A> method is often called from the overridden method to reset properties common to all column types derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn> class. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn.Initialize%2A> method is usually called during data binding, prior to the first row being bound.
When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn.Initialize%2A> method is used, the design mode of the column is set to `true`.
> [!NOTE] > This method is commonly used by control developers.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void InitializeCell (System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell cell, int columnIndex, System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemType itemType);

Public Overridable Sub InitializeCell (cell As TableCell, columnIndex As Integer, itemType As ListItemType)
public: virtual void InitializeCell(System::Web::UI::WebControls::TableCell ^ cell, int columnIndex, System::Web::UI::WebControls::ListItemType itemType);

abstract member InitializeCell : System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell * int * System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemType -> unit override this.InitializeCell : System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell * int * System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemType -> unit

Docs.param: A that represents the cell to reset.
The column number where the cell is located.
Docs.summary: Provides the base implementation to reset the specified cell from a column derived from the class to its initial state.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn.InitializeCell%2A> method provides the base implementation to reset the specified cell from a column derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn> class to its initial state. This method is not called directly. Instead, this method is inherited by a derived column class, which can then be used to reset a cell in the column of the derived type. You can optionally override this method in the derived class to provide a custom initialization routine. This base implementation of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn.InitializeCell%2A> method is often called from the overridden method to reset properties common to all cells in columns derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn> class.
In this implementation, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn.InitializeCell%2A> method resets only the header and footer cells. Other types of cells are not affected by this method.
When sorting is enabled (by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.AllowSorting%2A> property to `true`), a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinkButton> control is added to the header cell by default. This allows you to sort the column when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinkButton> control is clicked. If you specify an image for the header cell (by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn.HeaderImageUrl%2A> property), an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageButton> control is created instead.
When sorting is disabled, the text specified by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn.HeaderText%2A> property is displayed in the header cell. If you specify an image for the header cell (by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn.HeaderImageUrl%2A> property), an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Image> control is added to the header cell.
Because a browser will not display an empty cell, if an image in not displayed in the header cell and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn.HeaderText%2A> property is not set, a nonbreaking space HTML entity (` `) is displayed in the header cell. Similarly, if the footer cell does not have any content (if the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn.FooterText%2A> property is not set), a nonbreaking space HTML entity is displayed in the footer cell.
> [!NOTE] > This method is commonly used by control developers.

Docs.param: An that contains the saved state of the .
Docs.summary: Loads the state of the object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is used primarily by the .NET Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code. However, control developers can override this method to specify how a custom server control restores its view state. For more information, see [ASP.NET State Management Overview](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/0218d965-5d30-445b-b6a6-8870e70e63ce(v=vs.100)).
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn.LoadViewState%2A> method to load the state of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn> object. This allows a column to perform custom view-state management.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string SortExpression { get; set; }
Public Overridable Property SortExpression As String
public: virtual property System::String ^ SortExpression { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.SortExpression : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the field or expression to pass to the method when a column is selected for sorting.
Docs.value: The name of the field to pass to when a column is selected for sorting. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn.SortExpression%2A> property to specify or determine the name of the field to pass to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.OnSortCommand%2A> method when a column is selected for sorting.
> [!NOTE] > This property does not bind the column to a field in data source. To bind a column to a field, see the documentation for the specific column type.
When sorting is enabled, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinkButton> controls are rendered in the heading section of each column where the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn.SortExpression%2A> property is set.
> [!NOTE] > When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.AutoGenerateColumns%2A> property is set to `true`, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn.SortExpression%2A> property for each column in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control that supports data binding is automatically set with the field name bound to the column. If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.AutoGenerateColumns%2A> property is set to `false`, you need to manually set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn.SortExpression%2A> property with the field name bound to the column for each column that you want to enable sorting for.
These <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinkButton> controls allow you to sort the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control by the selected column. When a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinkButton> control for a column is clicked, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.SortCommand> event is raised. The value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn.SortExpression%2A> property for the selected column is passed to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.OnSortCommand%2A> event handler as part of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridSortCommandEventArgs> object.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn.SortExpression%2A> property to specify the field name to use for sorting.
[!code-aspx-csharp[DataGridColumnSortExpression#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/DataGridColumnSortExpression/CS/datagridcolumnsortexpressioncs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[DataGridColumnSortExpression#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/DataGridColumnSortExpression/VB/datagridcolumnsortexpressionvb.aspx#1)]
